Posts.Content: I've flagged your post, which might be inappropriate of me, but I wouldn't advocate anyone opening a link that they're not sure of. I've asked the moderators of the site to check it out first.
Posts.Title: Lump in right side of chest - Picture Included

Posts.Content: The majority of us are patients and cannot advise you on medical matters. Perhaps you could contact the cancerbackup nurses directly? They may be able to offer advice and reassurance.
Posts.Title: Lump in right side of chest - Picture Included

Posts.Content: I left the moderators to open your picture, cos I need to update my laptop security, so take no chances with links, they've confirmed that it's no risk... the photo that is. I'm afraid although I can see the lump, I can't enlighten you as to what it might be. Nice tattoo by the way.
Posts.Title: Lump in right side of chest - Picture Included

Posts.Content: Hi Nana There is no right and no wrong way to feel, just feel the way you're feeling. Treatment has come on such a long way with breast cancer, and you're being treated in a really good place. Take each day as it comes, if you're feeling good, then feel good and don't feel guilty, if you're feeling bad, it's ok, you have every right to. If you feel scared and don't want to burden your family with those feelings, come here.. we all know what you're going through and we can help you rationalise your feelings and fears.
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed, but why am i so calm?
